intro: Pentameris viscidula, commonly known as sticky pentameris, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, sticky stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. Its showy, five-petaled flowers are typically pink or red, blooming in summer. It thrives in moist, shady habitats and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks.
